intro: Dactylorhiza romana subsp. romana, commonly known as the Roman orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of fragrant, greenish-yellow to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. It has a complex life cycle involving a symbiotic relationship with specific mycorrhizal fungi. The species is considered rare and is protected in several countries due to habitat loss and over-collection.
